intro: Lamyra abylensis, commonly known as the Abilene lamyra, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of central Texas. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often used in traditional medicine by indigenous peoples. Lamyra abylensis is also valued for its ecological role in supporting pollinators in its native habitat.
